slides.title: Docker Container Architecture
slides.caption: Container isolation and resource management
slides.content:
ğŸ—ï¸ Container Technology Revolution

Docker containers package applications with all dependencies, ensuring consistent behavior across environments from development to production.

  • âš¡ Lightweight - Shares host OS kernel, minimal overhead
  • ğŸ”’ Isolation - Process and filesystem separation
  • ğŸ“¦ Portability - Run anywhere with Docker runtime
  • ğŸ”„ Version Control - Image layers and tags
  • ğŸ—ï¸ Microservices - Perfect for distributed architectures

Containers start in milliseconds vs minutes for VMs

slides.title: Kubernetes Cluster Orchestration
slides.caption: Automated container deployment and scaling
slides.content:
ğŸ›ï¸ Production-Grade Container Orchestration

Kubernetes automates deployment, scaling, and operations of application containers across clusters of hosts.

  • ğŸ“ˆ Auto-scaling - Horizontal and vertical pod scaling
  • ğŸ›¡ï¸ Self-healing - Automatic restarts and replacements
  • ğŸ”„ Rolling updates - Zero-downtime deployments
  • ğŸ” Service discovery - DNS-based load balancing
  • ğŸ’¾ Storage orchestration - Mount storage systems automatically

slides.title: CI/CD Pipeline Automation

ğŸš€ Continuous Integration & Deployment

Modern DevOps practices enable teams to deliver software rapidly and reliably through automated pipelines.

  • ğŸ”¨ Continuous Integration - Merge code changes frequently

slides.title: Interactive Quiz Examples
slides.subtitle: Engage your audience with knowledge checks

slides.question: What does REST stand for in web API design?
slides.explanation: REST stands for Representational State Transfer. It's an architectural style that uses stateless communication and standard HTTP methods. RESTful APIs are resource-based and support caching, layering, and uniform interfaces.

slides.question: Which data structure operates on LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle?
slides.explanation: A Stack operates on LIFO principle - the last element added is the first removed. Used in function call stacks, browser history, undo operations, and expression evaluation. Time complexity: O(1) for push/pop operations.

slides.question: What is the time complexity of binary search in a sorted array?
slides.explanation: Binary search has O(log n) complexity. Each iteration halves the search space. For 1 million elements, it takes only 20 comparisons (2^20 â‰ˆ 1 million). Much faster than linear search O(n).

slides.question: Which protocol provides secure communication over computer networks?
slides.explanation: SSL/TLS (Secure Sockets Layer/Transport Layer Security) provides encrypted communication, authentication, and data integrity. Used in HTTPS to secure web traffic, APIs, and sensitive data transmission.

Workflow Steps:
1. ğŸ—ï¸  Create feature branch from main
2. ğŸ’»  Make commits (G, H, I) on feature-1
3. ğŸ”„  Regularly merge main into feature branch
4. ğŸ“  Open Pull Request for code review
5. ğŸ‘€  Team review and approval
6. âœ…  Automated CI/CD pipeline runs
7. ğŸš€  Merge to main (M, N)
8. ğŸ—‘ï¸  Delete feature branch after merge

Best Practices:
â€¢ Keep features small and focused
â€¢ Write meaningful commit messages
â€¢ Review code thoroughly before merging
â€¢ Ensure all tests pass in CI pipeline

note.text: Feature branches enable parallel development while maintaining stable main branch
